'''Sacha''' was the name of a "fire-[[fay]]", according to the early version of the [[legendarium]] associated with ''[[The Book of Lost Tales]]''.<ref name="Say">{{PE|11}}, p. 66</ref>

While nothing else is known about the character specifically, in an addendum to the text ''[[The Creatures of the Earth]]'', the fays/spirits associated with the greater [[Valar]] are broken down into four elemental groups:<ref>{{PE|14}}, "[[The Creatures of the Earth]]", ''Valar'', p. 10</ref>
* Air (consisting of the [[manir]] and the [[súruli]])
* Earth (consisting of the [[tavari]], the [[nermir]], etc.)
* Water (consisting of the [[wingildi]], the [[oarni]], etc.)
* '''Fire''' - for which no group of spirits is given in the text

It is possible that Sacha belonged to some category of fays/spirits associated with the above mentioned '''Fire''' group.<ref>{{PE|14}}, "[[The Creatures of the Earth]]", p. 7</ref>

== Etymology ==
The name ''Sacha'' is in [[Gnomish]]. According to [[Paul Strack]], it is probably a derivative of the root [[SAH(Y)A]] ("be hot").<ref>{{webcite|author=[[Paul Strack]]|articleurl=http://eldamo.org/content/words/word-553271831.html|articlename=G. ''Sacha'' m.|website=Eldamo|accessed=2 April 2022}}</ref> Its [[Qenya]] cognate is '''''Sáya'''''.<ref name="Say"/>
